subsubsection.title: Vocabulary
subsubsection.p:

Function
Input variable
Independent variable
Dependent variable
Function value
Output variable

li.p: A function is a rule that assigns to each value of the input variable a unique value of the output variable.
Functions may be defined by words, tables, graphs, or equations.
Function notation: y = f (x), where x is the input and y is the output.
What property makes a relation between two variables a function?
Name three ways to define a function.
Give an example of a function in which two distinct values of the input variable correspond to the same value of the output variable.
Use function notation to write the statement "G defines w as a function of p."
Give an example of a function for which f (2 + 3)\ne f (2) + f (3).
